organization.fullName: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

identificationModule.briefTitle: Impact of a Focal Muscle Vibration Protocol in Front of the the Anterior Tibial Muscle in the Subacute Post-stroke Period on Motor Recovery in Hemiplegic Patients.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Impact of a Focal Muscle Vibration Protocol in Front of the the Anterior Tibial Muscle in the Subacute Post-stroke Period on Motor Recovery in Hemiplegic Patients.

leadSponsor.name: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
In about 40 percent of cases, after a stroke, neuromotor impairment leads to activity limitations and the development of chronic functional disorders, which have a significant impact on patient autonomy.

In the early subacute phase, motor deficit in foot lifters is one of the factors limiting standing posture and ambulation, which is ultimately difficult to rehabilitate due to the lack of available techniques for obtaining early onset of useful active voluntary contraction.

The use of muscular focal vibration therapy, applied to relaxed muscle, may be of interest due to the portability and availability of the system and the neuromotor benefits demonstrated in healthy subjects and in acute and chronic post-stroke patients.

armGroups.label: vibration program
armGroups.description: a 4-week program of muscular focal vibrations, at the rate of 5 sessions of 30 minutes per week, in addition to conventional rehabilitation. The program will apply a frequency of 100 Hz, with an amplitude of 1 mm
interventionNames: Other: Postural Assessment Scale for Stroke

armGroups.label: sham program
armGroups.description: a 4-week program of muscular focal vibrations, at the rate of 5 sessions of 30 minutes per week, in addition to conventional rehabilitation.
interventionNames: Other: Postural Assessment Scale for Stroke

interventions.name: Fugl-Meyer Assessment (FMA)
interventions.description: assessment of motor skills : measurement of the intensity of reflexes, as well as an assessment of voluntary movements and motor coordination Score from 0 to 34

interventions.name: Medical Research Concil (MRC)
interventions.description: evaluation of muscular strength score from 0 to 5

interventions.name: 2 Minute Walk Test (2MWT)
interventions.description: Assess functional walking and aerobic abilities

interventions.name: Timed Up & Go Test
interventions.description: measures the time it takes to get up from a chair, walk 10 feet, turn around, return to the seat and sit down

interventions.name: Modified Ashworth Scale
interventions.description: score from 0 to 4 evaluation of spasticity

interventions.name: Postural Assessment Scale for Stroke
interventions.description: score from 0 to 36 measures the patient's ability to maintain stable postures and balance in changes of position

interventions.name: posturographic recording
interventions.description: analysis of static equilibrium parameters and positional measurement of the center of gravity on the Winposturo platform

interventions.name: vibration program
interventions.description: a 4-week program of muscular focal vibrations, at the rate of 5 sessions of 30 minutes per week, in addition to conventional rehabilitation. The program will apply a frequency of 100 Hz, with an amplitude of 1 mm

interventions.name: sham program
interventions.description: a 4-week program of muscular focal vibrations, at the rate of 5 sessions of 30 minutes per week, in addition to conventional rehabilitation.

primaryOutcomes.measure: score of Fugl Meyer Assessment (lower limbs)
primaryOutcomes.description: score from 0 to 34 Stroke-specific performance-based disability index that quantitatively assesses analytical motor skills in the lower limb.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: score of Fugl Meyer Assessment (lower limbs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: score from 0 to 34 Stroke-specific performance-based disability index that quantitatively assesses analytical motor skills in the lower limb.
score of 0 (absence of contraction) to 5 (normal force)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: score of postural assessment scale for stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: measures the patient's ability to maintain stable postures, as well as balance in changes of position score of 0 (cannot perform the activity) to 36 (can perform the activity)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: positional measurement of the center of gravity

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Having had a stroke (with or without previous stroke) and being in the early subacute phase (between 14 days and 3 months of stroke).
* Responsible for a motor deficit in the right or left lower limb.
* No neurological history other than stroke.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Multifocal stroke
* Patient having received a botulinum toxin injection to the lower limb to be vibrated

locations.facility: Le Clos Champirol - Service de Médecine Physique et de Réadaptation
